casebody.data:
BRIGHT v. HAND. On Certiorari to a Justice of the peace. H. W. Creen,

moved for a reversal of the judgment, for the following reasons 1st. Because the judgment was rendered upon a writ of attachment issued against one only of two debtors on their joint promissory note.

2d. Because the suit was brought in the name of the payee of the note, although it was indorsed to a third person, and not re-assigned j and 3dly. Because the sum demanded exceeds fifty dollars.

By the Court,

either reason is sufficient cause for reversal.

Judgment reversed.
